test

Class ExampleTestClientTorrent

  • java.lang.Object
    • test.ExampleTestClientTorrent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, DownloadManagerListener

    public class ExampleTestClientTorrent
extends java.lang.Object
implements DownloadManagerListener
    Simple example to show how you can download files using bittorrent protocol starting with a given .torrent file.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Sandra Ferrer Celma

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExampleTestClientTorrent

        public ExampleTestClientTorrent(TorrentFile t,
                        java.lang.String pathTempFile,
                        int intervalUpdateListPeers,
                        int blockSize,
                        float thresholdEndGameTest,
                        boolean saveInformationTransfer)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        t - TorrentFile
        pathTempFile - String path where to save the downloaded file.
        intervalUpdateListPeers - float establishes the periodicity, in seconds, with which the peer is announced in the tracker; in accordance to the tracker protocol HTTP/HTTPS and the announceURL specified in the TorrentFile. The connections of the peers with which it interacts, will be revised, and new connections will be established, if the peers list returned by the tracker, contains new peers.
        blockSize - int determines the size, in KB, of the blocs. By default is 16 kB.
        thresholdEndGameTest - float determines when to activate EndGameStrategy. If it is -1 (by default value) will be activated according to the protocol defined by Bram Cohen (when all the pieces have been solicited). Otherwise, a percentage of total download of the file (i.e. 90%) is determined like the moment where will be activated the EndGameStrategy.
        saveInformationTransfer - boolean will save or not the information of he pieces sent or received of the peers. This information will be shown by logs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Error while processing torrent file. Please restart the client

      • ExampleTestClientTorrent

        public ExampleTestClientTorrent(byte[] torrentData,
                        java.lang.String pathTempFile,
                        int blockSize)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        torrentData - byte[]
        pathTempFile - String path where will save the download file.
        blockSize - int determines the size (in kB.) of the blocks. (By default is 16 kB.)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • downloadComplete

        public void downloadComplete()
        If it is a client and not is a seed, after to end the download, will be stopped the process.
        Specified by:
        downloadComplete in interface DownloadManagerListener

      • updatePeerListState

        public void updatePeerListState(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> mapState,
                       long lastTimeSendPieceBlock,
                       long lastTimeReceivePieceBlock,
                       long initTimeStartedProtocol)
        If it is a seed, it will stop the process if all the peers of the swarm are seed or if after it has been elapsed maximum time (in minutes) without to have received any request of any peer. If it’s not a seed, it will stop the process when there aren’t more peers in the swarm or if after it has been elapsed maximum time (in minutes) without to have received pieces of other peers.
        Specified by:
        updatePeerListState in interface DownloadManagerListener
        Parameters:
        mapState - Map
        lastTimeSendPieceBlock - long
        lastTimeReceivePieceBlock - long
        initTimeStartedProtocol - long

        Parameters:
        args -
